author: Steve Stroth
description: The Associated Press is challenging a ruling that allowed President Donald Trump to exclude the news agency from “restricted” spaces like the Oval Office and Air Force One.
title: Associated Press Challenges Ruling Limiting White House Access

author: Daniel Flatley, Annmarie Hordern
description: The US and China de-escalated trade tensions, agreeing to a preliminary deal on how to implement the consensus the two sides reached in Geneva, negotiators for both sides said.
title: US, China Officials Agree on Plan to Ramp Down Trade Tensions

author: Ryan Chua
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio rebuked five allies over sanctions they imposed on two members of Israel’s cabinet as fissures between the US and its partners widen over the war in Gaza and the treatment of Palestinians.
title: US Assails Sanctions by UK, Other Allies on Israeli Ministers

author: Mel Ambaye
description: Urban airports should use fiber-optic communications while Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite service may be better for rural ones, Senator Ted Cruz said.
title: Starlink Is Best for Rural Airports, Not So Much for Urban Ones, Cruz Says

author: David Voreacos
description: Days after Kilmar Abrego Garcia was brought back to the US to face human smuggling charges, the Trump administration asked a federal court to halt a lawsuit seeking answers over why the US hadn’t facilitated his return following his wrongful deportation to El Salvador.
title: US Seeks to Halt Abrego Garcia Deportation Case After His Return

author: Stacie Sherman, Gregory Korte
description: New York City’s mayoral contest has had plenty of drama ahead of the June 24 vote. The incumbent mayor, Eric Adams, decided not to participate in the Democratic primary in the wake of a corruption scandal and is running instead as an independent. The front-runner, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, is attempting a political comeback after leaving office in 2021 following multiple allegations of sexual harassment. And Cuomo’s closest challenger for the Democratic nomination is Zohran Mamdani,
title: How NYC’s Ranked-Choice Voting System Looms Over Mayoral Race

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will defend her fiscal choices and trumpet billions of pounds of infrastructure investment in the UK spending review on Wednesday, as Keir Starmer’s government seeks to regain momentum after a faltering first year in power.
title: Reeves Defends UK Economic Choices as She Touts Public Spending

author: Alex Vasquez
description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem accused Claudia Sheinbaum of encouraging anti-deportation protests in Los Angeles, drawing a rare rebuke from the Mexican leader who has sought to maintain cordial relations with the Trump administration.
title: Mexico’s President Pushes Back on Claim She Encouraged LA Violence

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Amazon.com Inc.’s chief security officer joined officials at other major tech companies in calling for fewer regulations in artificial intelligence, warning that government involvement in this rapidly emerging area risks narrowing the scope of the company’s work.
title: Amazon Security Chief Urges Hands-Off Approach to AI Regulation

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Former New York City Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg endorsed Andrew Cuomo in the city’s crowded Democratic mayoral primary, giving the former governor a boost two weeks before the election.
title: Former Mayor Bloomberg Backs Cuomo in NYC Democratic Primary

author: Chris Anstey
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics editor Chris Anstey writes about research into how economics and crime drove voting patterns. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Political Fault Lines on Display in LA Unrest Response

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s Supreme Court upheld former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner’s fraud conviction, ratifying her sentence to six years in prison as well as a lifelong ban on holding public office, according to local media.
title: Argentina’s Top Court Bans Kirchner From Public Office for Life

author: Joe Deaux, Eric Martin
description: The US and Mexico are closing in on a deal that would remove President Donald Trump’s 50% tariffs on steel imports up to a certain volume, according to people familiar with the matter, a revamp of a similar deal between the trade partners during his first term.
title: US, Mexico Near Deal to Cut Steel Duties and Cap Imports

author: Nayla Razzouk
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he plans to visit Greenland on Sunday to help counter any “predation” after US President Donald Trump said he wants to take over the self-ruling territory of Denmark.
title: Macron Seeks Greenland Visit to Counter ‘Predation’ After Trump

author: Akayla Gardner, Stephanie Lai, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US Education Secretary Linda McMahon said Tuesday the Trump administration was considering withholding education funding to California schools, alleging the state’s policies on transgender athletes violates federal law.
title: Trump Team Weighs Withholding Education Funding to California

author: Ari Natter, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration will propose scrapping Biden-era climate mandates requiring the nation’s power plants to curb planet-warming greenhouse gas emissions as soon as Wednesday, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Poised to Repeal Biden Curb on Power-Plant Pollution

author: Ari Natter
description: The Senate is considering a plan to save a lucrative tax credit for the production of hydrogen that would be scrapped in the tax-and-spending mega bill passed by the House, key Republicans said.
title: Hydrogen Tax Credit Rescue ‘On the Table,’ Key GOP Senator Says

author: Akayla Gardner
description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon said that Harvard and other universities could get some of the federal funding cut by the Trump administration restored if they change their policies.
title: Education Secretary McMahon Says Harvard May See Grants Restored

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Lauren Rosenthal, Brian K Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said his team will move forward with winding down much of the Federal Emergency Management Agency — but not until after a hurricane season that some projections show could be particularly deadly.
title: Trump Says FEMA Phaseout to Begin After Hurricane Season

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Tulsi Gabbard, the US director of national intelligence, released a video Tuesday warning that the world is closer to nuclear war than ever and accusing unnamed political elites of trying to foment conflict between world powers.
title: Gabbard Warns Global Nuclear Annihilation Is Closer Than Ever

author: Monique Vanek
description: South Africa’s president set up a panel that includes business leaders, actors and the captain of its national rugby team to guide a dialogue on the country’s future development path.
title: South Africa Names Rugby Captain, Business Leaders to National Dialogue Panel

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei laid out plans to save state coffers $1.5 billion annually by combating fraud and revamping government purchases, following a scandal over irregular medical leave by public employees.
title: Chile’s Matthei Details Plan to Save Billions in Public Spending

author: Cam Kettles
description: A key House committee chairman warned the Senate against passing a tax bill that fails to deliver on President Donald Trump’s campaign promises to exempt tips and overtime pay from taxes.
title: Trump Tax Bill Must Keep Tip, Overtime Breaks, House Chair Says

author: Faseeh Mangi, Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan plans to raise its defense budget by 17% following its conflict last month with India, a boost expected to help Chinese weapons suppliers.
title: Pakistan Raises Defense Budget 17% in Boost for Chinese Weapons Suppliers

author: Bill Allison, Sophie Alexander
description: Michael Grimes, the veteran technology investment banker who helped Elon Musk buy Twitter in 2022, reported assets worth as much as $98 million in a financial disclosure as part of his new role at the Commerce Department.
title: Musk’s Banker Michael Grimes Sells SpaceX, Anduril for Trump Job

author: Chris Palmeri
description: Sports-betting operator DraftKings Inc. said it’s weighing its next moves after a recent tax increase in Illinois.
title: DraftKings Anticipates ‘Taking Action’ After Illinois Tax Hike

author: Saleha Mohsin, Nancy Cook, Joshua Green
description: A growing chorus of advisers inside and outside the Trump administration are pushing another name to serve as the next chair of the Federal Reserve: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.
title: Bessent Emerges as Possible Contender to Succeed Fed’s Powell

author: Bob Van Voris
description: California’s lawsuit challenging the Trump administration’s deployment of troops to respond to protests in Los Angeles was assigned to a San Francisco federal judge, who will decide if the move was unlawful as Governor Gavin Newsom and the president trade blame.
title: California National Guard Case Assigned to Judge Charles Breyer

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO allies will consider allowing contributions to Ukraine’s defense to be included in the new spending target alliance members are expected to adopt at a leaders’ summit later this month.
title: NATO Seeks to Include Ukraine Funds in New Spending Target

author: Andreina Itriago, Matthew Bristow
description: At least 19 explosive blasts rocked southwest Colombia, bringing further terror to a nation still reeling from the attempted assassination of a presidential candidate days earlier.
title: Bomb Attacks Rock Colombia After Presidential Candidate Shot

author: Loukia Gyftopoulou, Joe Deaux
description: President Donald Trump’s surprise pick to lead an obscure federal agency that invests in development finance said he plans to take on more risk and attract private investors to its deals.
title: Trump Pick Ben Black Seeks More Risk, Private Investors for Development Agency Deals

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Alicia Clanton
description: Marines deployed by President Donald Trump arrived in the Los Angeles area after the city’s police chief warned of significant challenges to law enforcement if it was done without co-ordination with his department.
title: Marines Arrive in LA as Police Chief Warns Over Lack of Notice

author: Max Ramsay
description: The European Union plans to remove the United Arab Emirates from its list of countries that pose a high-risk for money-laundering, something the Gulf country has been pushing to happen.
title: EU Seeks to Remove UAE From Its Money Laundering Risk List

author: Erik Wasson
description: Republican Senator Thom Tillis said he expects the implementation of the Section 899 “revenge tax” in President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill to be delayed as it faces pushback from Wall Street and businesses.
title: Key Republican Senator Expects ‘Revenge’ Tax to Be Delayed

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India and the US will expedite trade talks to conclude an agreement that includes “early wins” for both sides, an official said, as the two nations race to clinch a deal before Washington’s tit-for-tat tariffs kick in next month.
title: India, US to Expedite Trade Talks Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Deadline

author: Roxana Tiron
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth pushed back against Democrats’ criticism of the decision to deploy troops to Los Angeles, telling Congress that the Trump administration wants to protect immigration agents and keep demonstrations there from getting out of control.
title: Hegseth Defends Deployment to LA, Estimated to Cost $134 Million

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s purchase of 88 Lockheed Martin Corp. F-35 fighter jets will cost far more than projected, and the country faces a potential shortage of qualified pilots to fly them, a government audit has found.
title: Lockheed Jet Deal to Cost Canada More Than $20 Billion, Auditor Says

author: Ethan Bronner
description: The US no longer wholeheartedly endorses an independent state for Palestinians, Washington’s ambassador to Israel said, adding that if one were to be formed it could be elsewhere in the region rather than the West Bank.
title: US Holds Deep Doubts About Palestinian State, Ambassador Says

author: Allyson Versprille
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Federal Aviation Administration plans to tell lawmakers that the US air traffic control system needs a “significant” influx of cash, according to prepared written remarks seen by Bloomberg.
title: Trump’s FAA Nominee Says Air Traffic Needs ‘Significant’ Investment

author: Joe Mayes, Galit Altstein
description: The UK government sanctioned two Israeli government ministers, Itamar Ben Gvir and Bezalel Smotrich, for inciting violence against Palestinian communities.
title: UK Government Sanctions Israeli Ministers Over Gaza Comments

author: Roxana Tiron
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told Congress Tuesday that the Pentagon’s collaboration with Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency found $6 billion in cuts so far from the agency’s budget of nearly $1 trillion.
title: Hegseth Says DOGE Found $6 Billion in Pentagon Budget Cuts

author: Lucy White
description: Television presenter David Bull will become the new chairman of Nigel Farage’s Reform UK, after his predecessor Zia Yusuf quit the party and then rejoined days later following a disagreement about whether burqas should be banned in Britain.
title: Farage’s Reform UK Appoints Murdoch TV Station Anchor as Chair

author: Enda Curran
description: The World Bank on Tuesday cut its forecast for global growth this year and warned that the 2020s are on track for the weakest performance for any decade since the first Apollo moon landing because of trade tensions and policy uncertainty.
title: World Bank Warns 2020s Face Weakest Global Growth Since 1960s

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Justice Department will resume investigations and prosecutions into bribes that companies or individuals pay to foreign governments or other entities with a renewed focus on protecting US businesses and industries.
title: Foreign-Bribery Probes Resume at DOJ With Focus on US Interests

author: Ishika Mookerjee, Faseeh Mangi, Akshat Rathi
description: Pakistan’s climate minister accused India of using dams to disrupt the flow of the Indus River system, as both countries seek international support amid a fragile ceasefire agreement.
title: India Is Disrupting Indus Water Flows, Pakistan Minister Says

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro blamed a global crime syndicate for an attempted assassination that’s shocked the Andean nation and left a contender for his job in critical condition.
title: Colombia’s Petro Blames ‘International Mafia’ for Senator Shooting

author: Paul Vecchiatto, Loni Prinsloo
description: The decision whether to award Elon Musk’s Starlink an operating license in South Africa will ultimately rest with the country’s industry regulator, a government minister said.
title: Musk’s Starlink License Decision Up to South African Regulator

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves rejected demands for extra police funding ahead of her spending review on Wednesday, despite warnings from senior officers that it could mean the government misses its flagship pledges on law and order.
title: Reeves Rejects Police Funding Demands Ahead of Spending Review

author: Henry Meyer
description: Russia is stepping up drone production enabling massive daily attacks on Ukrainian cities as its troops inch forward on the battlefield and Moscow presses Kyiv to concede to peace terms.
title: Putin Ramps Up Drone-Making to Unleash Attacks on Ukrainian Cities

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Arno Schuetze
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz reaffirmed he wants Commerzbank AG to remain independent and opposes a takeover by the Italian lender UniCredit SpA.
title: Merz Backs Commerzbank Independence in Letter to Works Council

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran will suggest a framework agreement in nuclear talks with the US, a senior official said, raising the prospect of an interim deal that could be followed by further negotiations.
title: Iran Seeks ‘Framework’ Deal in US Nuclear Talks, Official Says

author: Iain Rogers
description: The number of people granted German citizenship jumped by almost 50% to another record last year, with Syrians again fueling the surge as well as a significant increase in the naturalization of Russians.
title: Germany Grants Record Citizenships With Big Increase in Russians

author: Travis Waldron
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Lula’s Star Appeal Is Fading in Brazil

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The US and China resumed talks into a second day in London, with financial markets on edge as the world’s largest economies try to agree to allow exports of key tech and industrial goods and avoid escalating their trade war.
title: China and US Holding Second Day of Trade Talks in London

author: Julian Lee
description: Sanctioned tanker carries Sakhalin crude to Taiyo Oil’s Shikoku refinery
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Rebound With a Rare Delivery to Japan

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korean President Lee Jae-myung appointed Yeo Han-koo, a seasoned trade negotiator, as the new trade minister to guide the country through ongoing tariff talks with the US.
title: South Korea Appoints Yeo as Trade Minister to Lead Talks With US

author: James Mayger
description: Donald Trump brought many of the same grievances to his second trade war against China, but the economic battleground that’s emerged since then is making it harder to avoid a rupture this time around.
title: From Visas to Jets, US and China Are Finding New Trade Leverage

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: A top House Republican who oversees Pentagon spending expressed surprise and concern about Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s order last month to slash nearly half the staff of the Pentagon’s test oversight agency, even as the US embarks on major military initiatives including the F-47 fighter and the Golden Dome defensive system.
title: Key Congressman Questions Hegseth Decision to Slash Test Office

author: Josh Wingrove, Courtney McBride, Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump’s moves to deploy US troops to Los Angeles and hold a splashy parade on the Army’s 250th birthday fulfills his longtime goal of leaning on the military for a show of force and political power.
title: Unrestrained Trump Turns to Military in Second-Term Power Play

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Ireland’s senior government ministers are set to approve new rental control reforms as part of efforts to tackle the country’s acute housing shortage by luring more apartment investors to the market.
title: Irish Government to Reform Rent Cap in Bid to Boost Home Supply

author: Alastair Gale, Mari Kiyohara
description: Japan said it observed two Chinese aircraft carriers and supporting warships operating simultaneously near remote Japanese islands in the Pacific Ocean for the first time, a new demonstration of Beijing’s advancing naval capabilities.
title: China Sends Two Aircraft Carriers Into Pacific Ocean in a First

author: Yian Lee
description: Prosecutors in Taiwan have indicted two former officials, one of whom worked closely with the president, for leaking national security information to China, as Taipei pushes back against Beijing’s growing efforts to undermine the self-ruled democracy.
title: Taiwan Indicts President’s Aide on Charge of Spying for China

author: Tom Rees, Philip Aldrick, Irina Anghel
description: UK wages grew at the slowest pace for seven months and employment plunged, as the labor market continued to ease after Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government ramped up the cost of hiring.
title: UK Employment Drops Most Since 2020 and Wage Growth Cools

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has named Jenny Wilkinson as the nation’s new secretary to the Treasury, making her the first woman to hold the bureaucracy’s top economic post.
title: Australia Names Wilkinson Treasury Head, First Woman in Role

author: Peter Blumberg
description: President Donald Trump ordered the California National Guard on June 7 to dispatch at least 2,000 soldiers to the Los Angeles area as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces. After vandalism and violence broke out, the Pentagon escalated the federal response by also mobilizing 700 active-duty Marines.
title: Why Trump’s Deployment Of Military in California Is So Controversial

author: Ben Westcott
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has strongly condemned the shooting of an Australian journalist with a rubber bullet during protests in Los Angeles, describing footage of the incident as “horrific.”
title: Albanese Slams Shooting of Australian Journalist at LA Protest

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Lin Chen
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping held his first phone conversation with South Korea’s newly elected President Lee Jae-myung and called for cooperation to safeguard multilateralism and free trade.
title: Xi Urges South Korea’s Lee to Help Safeguard Free Trade

author: William Horobin
description: Eric Lombard is deploying his deal making skills to avert political turmoil
title: France’s Finance Minister Is the Calm Hand Macron Needs Now

author: John Harney, Julie Fine
description: Members of Texas’ Republican congressional delegation met on Monday to discuss the prospect of redistricting to try and tilt the state further in the GOP’s favor before the 2026 midterm elections.
title: White House Pitches Texas GOP on US House Redistricting Gambit

author: Alisa Odenheimer, Jon Herskovitz
description: All 12 people from an aid boat intercepted by Israel carrying Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg have arrived at port and are being transferred to the custody of Israeli authorities, the group involved said in a social media post.
title: Israel Takes Greta Thunberg and Aid Boat Crew Into Custody, Group Says

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada has invited Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to attend the Group of Seven summit, according to a person familiar with the matter, in another sign of a new approach to foreign policy under Prime Minister Mark Carney.
title: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince MBS Gets G-7 Invitation From Canada

author: Sakura Murakami
description: A 50% increase in average pay and a ¥1 quadrillion ($6.9 trillion) economy will be the top campaign pledges for this summer’s upper house election according to Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, as the date nears for voters to give their latest verdict on Ishiba’s administration.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Pledges 50% Pay Rise by 2040 Ahead of Elections

author: Edwin Chan, Jessica Sui
description: Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China in a front-page People’s Daily article, wading into one of the key topics dogging Washington-Beijing trade negotiations.
title: Huawei Founder Waves Off US Chip Curbs While Trade Talks Proceed

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Russia unleashed a sweeping drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv and the Black Sea city of Odesa that left a trail of destruction and killed at least one person, local authorities said.
title: Russia Unleashes Massive Drone Attack on Kyiv and Odesa, Kills 1

author: Malavika Kaur Makol, Kamran Haider
description: Investors in Pakistan are hoping Tuesday’s budget stays focused on slashing spending, boosting revenues, and reinforcing the government’s commitment to its International Monetary Fund loan program.
title: Investors Bank on No-Frills Pakistan Budget to Keep Rally Alive

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: The Irish government should commit to a domestic fiscal rule so it can better plan spending as the economy enters uncertain territory, the state’s fiscal watchdog warned.
title: Ireland Needs Fiscal Rule as Economic Risk Grows, Watchdog Warns
